channel.title: momtalkradio's Podcast
channel.description: Mom Talk Radio, the first radio talk show dedicated to real-life moms. Hosted by Maria Bailey, author, co-founder of BlueSuitMom.com and NewBaby.com and mother of four active kids. Each week Maria tackles issues important to moms, featuring expert guests with real-life an
channel.itunes:author: Mom Talk Radio
channel.itunes:summary: Mom Talk Radio is the first radio talk show dedicated to real-life moms. Our weekly radio show features news, guests and topics of interest to moms
channel.itunes:subtitle: News, guests and topics of interest to moms

item.title: Sumer Camp Options
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, Dr. Christine Horner, leading breast cancer prevention expert and author of Waking The Warrior Goddess. Children's Claritin "Moms on Air," Kristen Sutton from The Playful Mom talks about knowing your child's allergy triggers. Nathan McCall, the Marketing and Media Director of Pali Adventures discusses summer camp options. The Mom's Roundtable is joined by two Huggies MomInspired winners. Leslie Glickman from Yoga Journey.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Preparing for the End of the School Year
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, Jenny Lawson - The Blogess, and author of Let's Pretend this Never Happened (A Mostly True Memoir). Karen Worcester from Wreths Across America, tells us about the organization and Military Appreciation Month. E.G. Carter, author of the Carlousia book series tells us why today's young adults and teens are drawn to fantasy novels. The Mom's Roundtable discusses preparing for the end of the school year. And, CryptonHome's co-founder, Randy Rubin.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Keeping the Kids Active during the Summer
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, Tracey Bianchi, author of Mom Connection. Children's Claritin "Moms on Air" discusses planning ahead when dealing with your child's allergies. Whitney Johnson, author of Dare, Dream, Do: Remarkable Things Happen When You Dare to Dream. The Mom's Roundtable gives tips on how to keep the kids active during the summer. Kara Durbin, author of Parenting with Scripture.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Mother's Day
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, Vicki Lansky, author of Practical Parenting Tips. Dr. Daisy Sutherland, from DrMommyOnline.com talks about creating healthy boundaries with our teens. Erika Katz, parenting expert and Huffington Post contributor gives the top safety tips for prom night. The Mom's Roundtable discusses Mother's Day. Stacey Boyd of  Schoola.com discusses action parents can take when schools are facing budget cuts.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Ideas and Tips for a Mom's Night Out
item.description:
Join Maria as she speaks with author of Be a Better Dad Today, Gregory Slayton. Judy Christie, author of Hurry Less Worry Less for Moms. Alison Sweeney talks about the Little Miss Coppertone contest. In honor of National Mom's Night Out this Thursday, the Mom's Roundtable discusses ideas and tips for a Mom's Night Out. Whitney Moss, one of the authors of the new book, Stuff Every Mom Should Know.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Tips on Being a Work-At-Home-Mom
item.description:
Join Maria as she speaks with Kelly Stephenson from Kimberly Clark talks about Huggies Mom Inspired. Lisa M. Bennett from Simon Property Group tells us about National Mom's Nite Out. Kati Chevaux, editor from Cozi.com talks about moms, dads, kids, and their smartphones! The Mom's Roundtable discusses tips on being a work-at-home-mom. Dr. Harley Rotbart, author of No Regrets Parenting.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Celebrating Earth Month
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, The Style Network and HGTV star, Kelly Edwards discusses Celebrating Earth Month! Christina Daves from CastMedic Designs. Maureen Sullivan tells us about MAKERS: Women Who Make America. Claritin's "Moms on the Air" talks about planning ahead when dealing with seasonal allergies. Sabrina Pardue, founder of Go Cocktails!

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Prepping for Summer
item.description:
This week on Mom Talk Radio, Dr. Keith-Thomas Ayoob tells us about McDonald's new Happy Meal Chefs campaign. Ken Chaplin of SafetyWeb discusses child/ teen cell phone safety tips. Melissa H. Cook, author of The Power of Validation: Arming Your Child Against Bullying, Peer Pressure, Addiction, Self-Harm, and Out-of-Control Emotions. The Mom's Roundtable discusses prepping for summer! And, Tracy Walsh Deforge, founder of Burst.it gives tips on simple, smart, and secure ways to share life's moments.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: MADD's Power of Parents
item.description:
Join Maria as she speaks with Dr. Rob Turrisi, who talks about MADD's Power of Parents program and PowerTalk 21 day. Damon System provider, educator, and practicing orthodontist Dr. John Graham. The Mom's Roundtable discusses great books and book series for your children! Matt Cherry founder of Time Dog.

Award-winning nutritionist and author Dr. Rovenia Brock, aka Dr. Ro gives tips for balancing life while staying healthy. The Mom's Roundtable discusses springtime activities. Dr. Jennifer Caudle is back to continue expanding our knowledge on learning fibromyalgia.

item.title: Spring Break Plans
item.description:

item.title: Teaching Your Children About Money
item.description:

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: From Liz Claiborne's 8th Annual "It's Time to Talk" event
item.description:
Join Maria at the Liz Claiborne's 8th Annual "It's Time to Talk" event as she speaks with Ann Shoket, Editor-in-Chief of Seventeen Magazine. Stephanie Piston, State Director of the Sweetheart Program. Jennifer Kohn, Program Manager for the Allstate Foundation Domestic Violence Program. And, Allison Hall, Executive Director of PAAR, an agency that focuses on the treatment and prevention of Sexual Violence.

Since 1991 Liz Claiborne Inc. has been working to end domestic violence. Through its Love Is Not Abuse program, the company provides information and tools that men, women, children, teens, and corporate executives can use to learn more about the issue and find out how they can help end this epidemic.

This show is sponsored by Lands' End and Family Circle.

item.title: Join us for National Mom's Nite Out May 7, 2009!!!
item.description:
Today Maria talks abouts National Mom’s Nite Out on May 7th!!  It is the first nationally organized celebration of motherhood. Intended to bring together today’s moms, physically and virtually, National Mom’s Nite Out will unite over 150 social media groups, companies, local playgroups, mommy bloggers and mother social networks in giving moms a well deserved night off. Some of the guests this hour are hosting events.  Maria's guests include

Megan Calhoun the founder of TwiitterMoms.com  -- a site Redbook called "the new obsession among Web-savvy moms." and Lynnette Lauria the portfolio vice president of marketing for Indianapolis-based Simon Property Group, Inc., an S&P 500 company and the largest U.S. publicly traded real estate company.  Also, Lisa Hein, Speaker and Parenting Author of THE BOOK "I'm Doing The Best I Can!" (They won't always be cute and adorable) then, Kimberley Clayton Blaine is the executive producer of a grassroots mom webshow, called www.TheGoToMom.TV, she is a national parenting expert and a licensed Family and Child Therapist who specializes in working with children ages newborn to six years old.  Kimberley also teaches Early Childhood Brain Development and Positive Discipline Strategies at UCLA Extension Education Department.  Kimberley's new book is titled, Mommy Confidence: 8 Easy Steps to Reclaiming Balance, Motivation and Your Inner Diva at www.mommyconfidence.com
